algorithm_technique: Finding the minimum dimensions affected by all operations.
problem_summary_simple: Count the number of maximum values in a matrix after applying range increments.
problem_summary_technical: The maximum value will be in the top-left submatrix defined by the minimum `ai` and `bi` from all operations.
time_complexity: O(p), where p is the number of operations
key_insights: Each operation `[ai, bi]` increments all elements `M[x][y]` where `0 <= x < ai` and `0 <= y < bi`.
The cells that are incremented by *all* operations will have the maximum value.
These cells are precisely those within the intersection of all specified submatrices, which is determined by the minimum `ai` and minimum `bi`.
